awd_titl_txt: Engineering Research Equipment Grant:  Optical Systems for  Microprobe Research
awd_abstract_narration: Immobilized cells are in an environment which is drastically different          from that of free cells, and this is likely to change their metabolic           behavior.  Studies on this microenvironmental effect have been                  constrained by the limitations of experimental techniques on a                  micro-scale.  Microprobles and Micro-optodes will be developed for              measuring redox potential and the concentrations of important cellular          metabolities in the immediate vicinity of the immobilized cells.  A             1500X stereomicroscope and a monochromator with optical fiber                   input/output capabiliity will be required to facilitate the development         of the probes.  These new microprobes will provide new research                 capabilities, which will signficantly expand the scope of investigation         into the immobilized cell systems.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
